# Week 1 - Version Control (git)

## New to terminal and ssh?
### Windows
* [PIC Lab tutorial on PuTTY](https://www.pic.ucla.edu/frequently-asked-questions/setting-up-your-pic-linuxemail-account/)
* 64-bit Windows 10? You're in business. [Bash on Windows 10 tutorial](https://www.howtogeek.com/249966/how-to-install-and-use-the-linux-bash-shell-on-windows-10/)
* *In My Humble Opion (TM)* if you are not using 64-bit Windows which has a built-in bash environment, you may as well just use [Git GUI for Windows](https://git-scm.com/download/gui/windows)...

### MacOSX
* open *Terminal* from Applications
```bash
brew tap homebrew/dupes
brew install openssh --with-brewed-openssl --with-keychain-support
# come to me iif your brew is failing.
# you might have to install Xcode... but how can you not have Xcode?
```
### Linux
* figure out yourself. 
* JK. You probably know ssh already. 
```bash
sudo apt install openssh-client
```

## Demo: step-by-step initializing your own git repository (using GitHub with MacOSX terminal)
* create a GitHub.com or BitBucket.com account
* (skip this for BitBucket) sign up for [GitHub Education](https://education.github.com/pack/offers) to create private repositories for free
* Profile settings -> SSH and GPG keys -> New SSH Key (follow [tutorial](https://help.github.com/articles/connecting-to-github-with-ssh/) provided on this page to generate ssh key)
* create a new repository
* click "Clone or download" to access the repository URL
```bash
cd # this takes you to ~/
git clone git@github.com:$(your_account_id)/$(your_repository name).git
```
* take a look at your file system!
* explore ```git commit -am [message]```, ```git log```, ```git checkout [commit id]``` (*detached HEAD*?), ```git reset``` (HEAD, --hard, --soft), ```git rm```, ```git revert```, ```git push```, etc.

## Not liking Bash? Pick [your own cup of tea](https://git-scm.com/download/gui/mac) for GitGUI!
* [GitHub Desktop](https://desktop.github.com/) is also pretty fashionable

## diff-tool
* [meld](http://meldmerge.org/)

## .gitignore
Do a ```git status```, what do you see? 

```.(some_file).DS_store```? (MacOSX system generated *Desktop Services Store* files)

```.(some_file).ini```? (similar stuff generated by Microsoft Windoes)

Set up your ```.gitignore``` today!!! (check out my [sample](https://github.com/evastgh/problems_and_solutions/blob/master/.gitignore))

## Side Notes
* StackOverflow is your good friend. Google *literally* your question and there's probably already an answer. 
* Like my terminal? Check [this](https://gist.github.com/kevin-smets/8568070) out! 
* Like my editor? Google ```vim``` (you can later email me and ask for my ```.vimrc``` ðŸ¤£)
* Like my notes? Google ```MarkDown``` or check [this](https://jbt.github.io/markdown-editor/#) out!
